result.execSummary:
The defendant Sam J. STEGEMANN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Continue and complete counseling with Dr. Burbach.

Defendant must surrender his cycle endorsement and not operate a motorcycle during the period of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.

Additional thirty (30) days in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sam J. STEGEMANN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was terminated from probation effective 01-29-2016
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letter from Attorney Pawlowski to Judge Fox with letter from Dr. Burbach attached.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-09-14 at 10:00 a.m.  Plea date is set for 01-29-15 at 9:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-24-14 at 8:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection; Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover letter.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of fleeing an officer and reckless driving.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
